text: Francis Leicester Butler (25 February 1856 – 26 August 1885) was an Australian first-class cricketer. The son of Charles Butler, a solicitor of the Supreme Court of Tasmania, he was born at Battery Point in Hobart in February 1856. He studied in England at St John's College, Oxford. While studying at Oxford, Butler made a single appearance in first-class cricket for the South in the North v South match of 1877 at Hull. In a match in which he played alongside his brother, Edward, he scored 3 unbeaten runs in the South's first-innings. A student of the Inner Temple, he was called to the bar in November 1880. Butler died at Westminster in August 1885, having practised law primarily in Tasmania. Another brother, Charles, also played first-class cricket, as did his nephew Leo Butler. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1856 births Category:1885 deaths Category:People from Hobart Category:Australian expatriates in England Category:Alumni of St John's College, Oxford Category:Members of the Inner Temple Category:Australian cricketers Category:North v South cricketers Category:Australian barristers
title: Francis Butler (cricketer)
